alert.note: Alert for Larimer (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 17 at 12:19AM MDT until June 17 at 1:45AM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 145 AM MDT EARLY THIS MORNING FOR CENTRAL LARIMER COUNTY... At 1219 AM MDT, Thunderstorms have moved out of the warning area. Between 0.5 and 1 inch of rain fell in the Miller Fork drainage north of Glen Haven in about 45 minutes. Flash flooding is likely occurring along the Miller Fork. In the Pennock Pass area, minor flooding is likely occurring in susceptible areas. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, gulches, roads, and poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Pennock Pass and Miller Fork north of Glen Haven. This includes the following additional locations... Box Prairie. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Heavy Rainfall will cause flash flooding of small creeks, streams, and ditches in the affected part of the Cameron Peak burn area. Rock slides or debris flows can also be expected across rural roads.
